Our client, a leader in innovative consumer products, is hiring a Machine Learning/AI Engineer! As the first ML/AI Engineer on our R&D team, you’ll build an ML model from scratch that integrates with their products to deliver incredible, enhanced features to their customers. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to design, build, and deploy machine learning models, algorithms, and software components that enable data-driven decision-making and improve product performance.

Recognized as a Best Places to Work in SoCal in 2023, our client is constantly innovating and delivering new solutions to their customers. They're a team of innovators where curious experimenting is celebrated, learning is encouraged, and initiative is rewarded. They offer a flexible work schedule with two days’ work-from-home and a kitchen full of snacks to keep you charged throughout the day.

What You’ll Do
Design, develop, and optimize ML algorithms and models to provide predictive maintenance, anomaly detection, energy efficiency, and other relevant features.
Preprocess and clean large datasets to extract valuable insights and features for ML models and conduct exploratory data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and potential improvements.
Train ML models - evaluate model performance, iterate on models, and fine-tune parameters to achieve optimal results.
Integrate ML models into existing products and work with the software team to ensure seamless deployment and integration of AI-driven solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI initiatives with business goals.

What You Bring
Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or related fields.
Proven experience developing an ML model from scratch.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or similar.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Familiarity with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and services for model deployment and management.

Excellent benefits!
Matching 401k up to 4% with immediate vesting.
Healthcare premiums are covered at 80% for you and your family with HSA and FSA options.
Supplemental Term Life, Employee Assistance Programs (EAD), and more.
Hire to Retire philosophy that includes personal career development plans.
Bonuses based on company and personal performance.

JOB TITLE: Data Scientist
DEPARTMENT: Innovation Lab
LOCATION: Remote
REPORTS TO: Technical Director, Innovation Lab
JOB CLASSIFICATION: Full-Time; Exempt; Non-Union

PURPOSE OF THE JOB:
The Innovation Lab at Human Rights First, created in 2019, houses the world’s first digital technology incubator dedicated solely to the advancement of human rights. The Innovation Lab develops products and services that leverage artificial intelligence and other new digital technologies to protect human rights and democracy. The Lab’s resources are currently being applied to assist modern war crimes investigations, protect the integrity of our elections, combat white nationalist extremism in the US, and document human rights violations at the US / Mexico border.
As a Data Scientist at Human Rights First, you will hold a pivotal role in leveraging and advancing artificial intelligence and machine learning to promote and extend human rights. Your responsibilities will involve designing and constructing sophisticated machine learning models, exploring uses and applications of AI, helping to extract meaningful and actionable data from diverse data streams, as well as refining and updating existing systems.
In order to thrive in this position, you must possess exceptional skills in statistics and programming, as well as a deep understanding of data science and software engineering principles. Your ultimate objective will be to explore the intersection of technology and human rights to create high impact applications that can multiply the efficacy of human rights defenders and practitioners around the world. Join us and be at the forefront of innovation at the intersection of technology and human rights.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities (Essential Functions**):
Develop, train, and fine-tune machine learning and deep learning models for various applications, such as natural language processing, computer vision, recommendation systems, or predictive analytics.
Prepare and preprocess large datasets, including data cleaning, feature engineering, and handling missing values to ensure high-quality input for machine learning models.
Implement rigorous model evaluation techniques, including cross-validation, A/B testing, and performance metrics, to assess model accuracy and generalization.
Optimize model performance through hyperparameter tuning and experimentation to achieve the best possible results.
Deploy machine learning models into production environments, working closely with software engineering teams to ensure seamless integration.
Continuously monitor model performance and implement improvements as necessary, including staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML research.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and stakeholders, both internal and external, to translate project/program requirements into AI/ML solutions.
Ensure ethical considerations in AI/ML development, including fairness, transparency, and bias mitigation, aligning with best practices and regulations.
Create comprehensive documentation for models, code, and processes to facilitate knowledge sharing and maintainability.
Support Lab’s rapid response efforts in the face of abuses of technology to infringe on human rights, and other special projects
Support communication of HRF’s technology and innovation work – in particular to technical audiences - through project/product demos, creative content, videos, and presentations
Other duties as required.
Supervision Received:
The AI/ML Engineer will formally report to the Lab’s Technical Director for professional development and support. This role is for an experienced and semi-autonomous technologist with expert command of their role and responsibilities.
QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:
Required:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or certification/specialized program completion in equivalent area of study.
2-5 years of relevant work experience in machine learning, including hands-on model development and deployment.
Proficiency in programming languages commonly used in AI/ML, such as Python and libraries/frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
Strong expertise in data preprocessing, data wrangling, and feature engineering to extract valuable insights from raw data.
Proven track record of building and fine-tuning machine learning models, including deep learning, and familiarity with neural network architectures.
Experience with deploying models to production environments using containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes).
Understanding of ethical considerations in AI/ML, including bias mitigation, fairness, and interpretability.
Familiarity with relevant AI/ML tools and libraries, as well as version control systems like Git.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to tackle complex AI/ML challenges.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
A commitment to staying updated with the latest developments in AI/ML through research, online courses, or conferences.
Deep interest in the intersection of emerging technology, human rights, and democracy
Ability to make decisions in a changing environment and anticipate future needs
Self-motivated individual must be able to work collaboratively in fast paced team environment with competing priorities
Deals with confidential information and/or issues using discretion and judgment.
Preferred:
Experience and passion in human rights, democracy and/or social justice fields
Understanding of development styles (test, event, type driven development, etc)
Please include resume, cover letter, and project or case study demonstrating analysis of data, use of machine learning or modern AI technologies.
Human Rights First is committed to recruiting, retaining, and developing staff from a diversity of backgrounds, including members of racial and ethnic minorities, LGBTQ people, people with disabilities, people of all socioeconomic backgrounds, people of all nationalities, and veterans of the U.S. Armed Forces. We believe that a diverse staff and an inclusive work environment that welcomes a range of perspectives make us stronger and more effective.

About The Company
Gwyneth Paltrow launched goop from her kitchen as a homespun weekly newsletter. It's grown a lot since then; goop is a lifestyle platform encompassing curated products and content about beauty, wellness, fashion, food, and home. Pioneering the contextual commerce platform, goop allows readers to shop with meaning. goop is one of the rare places on the web where food, shopping, and mindfulness collide—where the ever-evolving intent is to make every choice count. We're all resource-strapped, so goop hopes to surface the very best experiences, recipes, products, and advice.
About You
You thrive in an end-to-end data environment where you have the opportunity to build and deploy data pipelines, enhance and develop frameworks, and test + deploy production-level models that impact how we interact with our customers.
About The Role
goop seeks a talented and innovative Data Scientist to help us capitalize on opportunities in our broad and ever-growing datasets. As a part of the Data Science team, you will spend time working cross-functionally with engineers, product managers and marketers to build and test new consumer-facing algorithms and models.
Responsibilities Include:
Enhance, develop, deploy production level machine learning models and algorithms that will improve goop's customer experience.
Participate in the full development cycle: design, develop, QA, deploy, experiment, analyze, and iterate.
Collaborate and partner with key stakeholders throughout the organization. Identify opportunities to utilize Data Science to enhance business outcomes/customer experience.
Qualifications & Experience
Bachelor's degree in engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other highly quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3+ years of hands-on experience in data science, ideally with a focus in building production level machine learning solutions (product/content recommendation, personalization, prediction/forecasting, customer segmentation, NLP, classification etc.)
Advanced level in Python programming with extensive experience with the ML ecosystem - pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
Experience developing and deploying inference endpoints.
Advanced level experience with relational databases (SQL) and unstructured & semi-structured data
Understanding of A/B testing and practical application of inferential statistics
Working knowledge of AWS infrastructure and data tools (S3, SageMaker, Airflow, etc.)
FAQ
Compensation: $90,000-$102,500 + Equity. This is a full time, exempt role. Please note that this range represents the low and high end of the anticipated base salary range for the Los Angeles, CA based position. Goop, in good faith, reasonably expects to pay the position within this salary range. Goop provides the salary range in compliance with all applicable federal, state and local laws. The actual base salary will depend on numerous factors such as: experience, training, knowledge and skills, and if the location of the job changes.
Benefits: Generous health benefits package, fertility benefits and paid parental leave.
Perks: "goopcation" paid company summer break, generous goop discounts, special offers with brand partners, access to custom lifestyle resources and events, and a beautiful work space in Santa Monica
Work Philosophy: At goop we believe that creativity, innovation and camaraderie are essential to our business, our culture and our employee's growth and development. With our Hybrid Work Policy, we are committed to promoting collaboration, productivity and employee well-being by maximizing the benefits of both in-person and remote work. We are in office Tuesdays and Thursdays, as well as Mondays for those within a 15-mile radius of our Santa Monica office.
goop is an Equal Opportunity Employer. goop does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. All information provided by the applicant is collected, stored and processed in accordance with the terms of our CCPA Notice for Job Candidates.
Job Disclosures: No applicant disclosures related to physical requirements or ADA-related considerations are relevant for this role
Application Requirements: All applicants will be reviewed through Greenhouse submission. Direct submissions to the People Operations Team members will not be reviewed separately.
Candidate Requirements: Applicant must have US work authorization.

If you are an enthusiastic individual who likes to work on a range of cutting-edge problems, in a unique field that brings together big data, machine learning, information retrieval and software development, Bilin Technology is looking for a Data Scientist to join our Engineering team in Boston MA
You will be a key member of the data science team with potential to grow into a bigger role.
Our work spans from information retrieval to real-time computation of core optimization algorithms, post-hoc data modeling, analysis and reporting.
Our research and development efforts focus on developing new capabilities to meet the expanding scope of our business, as well as improving the performance and scalability of our current optimization and measurement platform.
POSITION DESCRIPTION
You will be responsible for the research, design and development of advanced information retrieval, machine learning and statistical algorithms expanding our current analytical tools and capabilities. Specific responsibilities include:
Recommending or developing new learning algorithms suitable for information retrieval and modeling of big data.
Designing stochastic simulations for testing and validation of regression models, learning or optimization algorithms.
Improving the computational efficiency and scalability of various statistical models.
Development, implementation and maintenance of standard programming practices across analytics codebase.
Keeping up with the state-of-the art in relevant areas – Machine Learning, Big Data, Information Retrieval and Natural Language Processing.
REQUIREMENTS
Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or other relevant scientific field.
High academic achievement (GPA > 3.6/4.0) from a leading school.
Solid understanding of algorithm complexity, mathematical modeling, probability and statistics.
Deep understanding of information retrieval and natural language processing.
Firm knowledge of classical machine learning techniques such as SVMs, neural network and centroid-based as well as hierarchical clustering algorithms.
2+ years of experience with scripting languages like R and Python.
2+ years of object oriented and functional programming experience (Java).
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex ideas in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.
In addition to the above requirements, the following would be desirable:
Experience with Scala and Apache Spark.
Familiarity with cutting-edge techniques in text mining, sentiment analysis and feature extraction.
Experience with Relational Databases and SQL programming.
Experience with data visualization.
Benefits
We offer: competitive salaries, 401k match and a casual work environment.

Come join a winning team! Here at Imprivata, you’ll see a dedicated group of professionals who care about improving healthcare. Our team thrives on collaboration and sharing ideas, whether in a cross-functional meeting or at one of our virtual team-building events.
While we're diverse in our backgrounds and skills, we have much in common. A passion for our mission. A strong sense of integrity. A belief that we're making a positive impact and a commitment to having fun.
We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join our team to join our team for this hybrid opportunity working out of our Waltham, MA; Austin, TX; or St. Petersburg, FL offices. We are also extending this as a remote opportunity to candidates located in the Chicago, IL metropolitan area.

Job Summary

The Data Science team is responsible for building out the machine learning capabilities of Imprivata's Digital Identity Platform, with specific projects ranging from detecting patient privacy violations to using machine learning to empower what would be otherwise manual workflows. As a Sr. Data Scientist, you'll be deeply involved in every aspect of the project lifecycle, including gathering requirements, cleaning and exploring datasets, running machine learning experiments, and deploying services to production.

Duties and Responsibilities

Put ethics and security first. The datasets that we use almost invariably contain PHI or similarly sensitive information, and we take the responsibility that comes with that access seriously.
Drive business value with machine learning. That includes everything from initial framing of the problem, to pulling and working with data, to training models, to communicating results.
Write high quality, production Python code. While we work closely with other engineering teams, we don't hand off research code to be productionized by someone else
- we own our solutions end-to-end and do our best to keep raising the technical bar.
Build a breadth of machine learning knowledge. Beyond actually training models, you'll rely on that fluency when it comes to tasks like gathering requirements or iterating on model output with subject matter experts.
Communicate effectively. Taking your project from business problem to production service isn't a solo exercise; you'll need to work well with people from other teams and our own in order to succeed.
Improve the team. Everyone is responsible for making the team better: as a Sr. Data Scientist, you'll have an informal mentorship role by way of things like pair programming and providing meaningful code reviews.
Qualifications
Excellent problem solving skills.
Solid experience with Python and common Data Science packages, such as NumPy, pandas, and scikit-learn. Additional experience with relevant packages such as PyTorch, Dask, Pydantic a plus.
Strong understanding of standard machine learning techniques such as classification, regression, clustering, dimensionality reduction. Additional expertise in specific areas such as NLP, anomaly detection, graph methods, etc. a plus.
Proficiency with SQL and relational databases.
Experience working in a Unix environment.
2-5 years of data science experience.
This position offers a salary range of $121,800.00 to $149,800.00 (inclusive of variable compensation such as bonuses and incentives). In addition, more information about Imprivata’s benefit offerings can be found here. This salary range represents the high and low end of Imprivata’s salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors, such as a candidate’s location, skills, experience, and qualifications.
At Imprivata, we have a top-notch work environment, developmental opportunities, a competitive total rewards package, and the desire to have fun. If you have the skills and qualifications as we have described above, we want to hear from you!
Imprivata provides equal employment opportunities, regardless of race, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Our dynamic, exciting team of subject-matter experts comes from diverse backgrounds and experiences, including market research, data science, digital analytics, finance, and consulting. Hands on experience working in big data environments such as Hadoop, Spark, and using Python / SQL or comparable languages for manipulating and analyzing complex clickstream and or unstructured data.

The RAZR Core Values You Live

Overview
As a Data Analyst at RAZR Marketing, you will play a crucial role in leveraging data to drive informed business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in ETL development, experience building data pipelines using AWS Glue, and a passion for conducting insightful data analysis on large datasets. The role will be integral in supporting and optimizing our infrastructure hosted in AWS.

What You Love To Do
ETL Development: Design, develop, test, and maintain Python-based ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into our data ecosystem.
Pipeline Development: Build and maintain efficient and scalable data pipelines using AWS Glue to ensure the seamless flow of data within the organization.
Data Analysis: Conduct in-depth data analysis on large datasets to derive meaningful insights and present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Infrastructure Management: Work closely with the infrastructure team to optimize and troubleshoot data-related issues in our AWS-hosted environment.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, business analysts, and IT professionals, to understand data requirements and contribute to data-driven decision-making processes.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for ETL processes, data pipelines, and data analysis methodologies.
Qualifications
5+ years of relevant professional experience.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in ETL development.
Strong expertise in building and maintaining data pipelines (preferably using AWS Glue).
Experience working with large datasets and performing data analysis.
Experience with business reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, or similar
Familiarity with AWS services, particularly those related to data management.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
About Us
RAZR is a fast-growing marketing technology company headquartered in the Twin Cities, and we count some of the world’s most recognized brands among our clients. Working across a spectrum of industries including healthcare, medical technology, financial services, and retail, we help our clients acquire, retain, and grow consumers by leveraging our proprietary technology platform Fibonacci™. The RAZR approach is rooted in behavioral science and combines strategy, with visual design to create sustainable behavior change within consumer audiences.
With our Clients, Colleagues, and in our Communities we live our Mission - Be Relevant – “Make a meaningful difference in the lives of others”. At the foundation of our Culture you’ll find the Core Values of “Be Intentional”, “Embrace the Attitude of How”, and “Enjoy the Ride”, this is a mindset and a commitment to how we show up every day. The RAZR team is driven and we pursue the ultimate best outcome for our key constituents. There are no jobs here, just opportunities to serve and make a material impact in the world.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and our employees are individuals with unique strengths, experiences and backgrounds, who share a passion for improving people's lives.
Technology:
Stack: Java, Angular, NestJs, Postgres, Docker, AWS serverless/cloud native.
Build tooling: GitHub, Jenkins, NxCloud, Terraform/Pulumi (IaC).
JavaScript Testing frameworks: Jest, Cypress, nock.
Java Testing frameworks: JUnit, Spock, Mockito.
Hosting: AWS.
Teams following Scrum framework implementation of Agile.
Source control via Git and collaborating via pull requests.
If you are a talented and motivated individual who is passionate about leveraging data for business success, we invite you to apply by submitting your resume and a cover letter. Be sure to highlight your relevant experience and why you are a great fit for the Data Analyst role at RAZR Marketing.

Philo: TV on the Internet (TVoIP)
At Philo, we're a group of technology and product people who set out to build the future of television, marrying the best in modern technology with the most compelling medium ever invented — in short, we're building the TV experience that we've always wanted for ourselves. In practice this means leveraging cloud delivery, modern tech stacks, machine learning, and hand-crafted native app experiences on all of our platforms. We aim to deliver a rock solid experience on the streaming basics, while cooking up next generation multi-screen and multi-user playback experiences.
Data Science at Philo
Data underpins everything we do at Philo: making informed business decisions; analyzing and improving the quality of our streaming experience; running product experiments to optimize our signup flows; and making it easier for our users to find the perfect thing to watch. On the Data Science team, we're looking for someone who is comfortable working on a variety of ad auction and placement optimization problems, using experimentation to improve our ads systems, and helping to lead our team in balancing monetization and quality of experience considerations across our streaming service. You'll be working closely with other data scientists, analysts, and engineers to build and deploy solutions directly for our service.

We are passionate about problem-solving and providing data-informed insights for the entire company using both cutting-edge techniques and proven practices in close collaboration with every department. To complete our work we build on modern open-source tools including dbt, GrowthBook, Robyn, Superset, and PyTorch as well as SaaS tools such as Segment, SageMaker, AWS Glue, Mode, Avo, and BigEye.

Some of the recent projects our Data Science team members have worked on include:
Modeling to determine which early product behaviors predict conversion
Running experiments to evaluate the impact of alternative ad bidding strategies
Building data models for analysis of lifetime value of customers including ad revenue
Price sensitivity research and competitive market analyses
Qualifications
Philo is seeking a Senior Advertising Data Scientist with demonstrated understanding of statistical modeling, A/B/n experimentation practices, SQL, and experience independently developing data driven insights. This data scientist will have the opportunity to leverage massive structured, unstructured, transactional, and real-time data sets from a variety of sources, analyze financial and customer usage patterns, and make actionable recommendations to product, marketing, engineering, and business development teams.

In this role the Senior Advertising Data Scientist will support the entire product development lifecycle for our advertising systems from feature ideation and opportunity sizing to measurement and experiment design, and from causal analysis and post-launch learning to the next development cycle. Senior Data Scientists at Philo contribute to mentorship and leadership on the Data team whether they are people managers or individual contributors. Individuals with prior experience with people management or an interest in people management will have the opportunity to add that responsibility to their role at Philo.

Responsibilities:
Build a deep understanding of how subscribers use Philo on each of our streaming platforms, how that usage influences advertising performance and defining the metrics to evaluate new features in our advertising systems
Own analytics and tracking plans, within several development work streams, from metric definition and data instrumentation design to ongoing reporting and research
Iteratively improve our experimentation methods and establish best practices for experiments in a live advertising auction environment
Establish curated dashboards that will serve as the primary source by which we evaluate the performance of features
Run queries to support ad-hoc product questions and create Mode dashboards and other visualizations for stakeholders
Own your analytics projects, proactively identify issues and opportunities, test hypotheses, and propose solutions
Collaborate with groups company-wide (e.g. business development, advertising operations, marketing, and support) on KPIs, including lifetime value, retention, win-back, and content consumption metrics
Key Qualifications:
10+ years of experience in a Data Science role, preferably with experience managing analysts, engineers, or data scientists. Demonstrated ability to influence product roadmaps and business decisions with data
Proven expertise in experimental design (including but not limited to A/B testing), principles of causal inference, and statistical techniques
Experience with relational databases and SQL
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain and present analytical methodology and results to non-technical audiences
Expert with statistical analysis in either R or Python
Strong analytics fundamentals – a degree in statistics, economics, a related field, or similar professional experience
Experience in writing production-quality code in R/Python, productionizing data models and statistical models with tools such as Git, Sagemaker, and dbt, and using software engineering best practices around version control, review, and automated testing
More about Philo
We strive to build engaging and easy to use streaming apps across a large number of platforms (Android Mobile, Android tablets, Android TV, Amazon FireTV, Roku, iOS, Apple TV, Samsung, and web), while delivering a large variety of content to our users.
Today there are over 60 channels included in our basic package - our lineup includes many popular cable networks, like A&E, Accuweather, Animal Planet, AXS TV, BBC America, BET, Cheddar, ComedyCentral, CMT, Discovery Channel, Food Network, Game Show Network, Hallmark, HGTV, IFC, INSP,Lifetime, MTV, Newsy, Nickelodeon, OWN, Paramount Network, Sundance, TV One, Vice and VH1. We also offer premium add-on channels from Starz and Epix, and we're always adding more content!
We're a company that puts people first — both our subscribers and our team. At Philo, our philosophy is to empower our colleagues to do their best work while supporting each other in pursuing shared goals. We value pragmatism, pride in our work, and passion. We believe in having transparency and openness across all parts of the company. We are committed to diversity and inclusion as we grow the Philo team and shape the future of TV - we believe that a diverse set of voices and perspectives on our team enables us to innovate faster and create the best experience for our subscribers.
Philo is headquartered in San Francisco, with additional offices in New York and Cambridge, MA. Our leadership team includes a cofounder of Facebook as well as alums of Meraki and HBO. Philo is backed by NEA and industry partners including Discovery, Viacom, AMC, and A&E.

Job Description
This is a remote position.
Info Gain Consulting is a CMMI-DEV L3 appraised, and SBA Certified 8(a) Small business. Our federal clients value our ability to bring together expertise in people, processes, technology, and data to help them prepare for growth, manage risk, and improve operations.
We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our team, supporting the Department of Defense (DoD) Office of Inspector General (OIG). Reporting: Generate clear and concise reports and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and provide data-driven solutions.
Compliance: Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations in all data-related activities.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data science.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data analysis methodologies and findings.

Sphinx provides services to an array of clients within the US Intelligence Community, Department of Defense, Cleared Defense Contracting, Defense Industrial Base, and Private Sector. Data Scientist
Sphinx Data Scientists provide an array of data analytics, engineering, mining, and development solutions. They leverage predictive analysis, statistical analysis, and other scientific techniques to correlate data into visualization and narratives that enable data-based decision making. Data Scientist in this position will provide support to a strategic intelligence program, enabling them to make operational decisions and establish priorities based upon a holistic understanding of the data. This position requires experience, passion, and a willingness to develop solutions to challenging problems with minimal oversight and direction.

Location: Quantico, VA
Salary Range: $150,000-$225,000

Description: The Data Scientist will provide full-spectrum data science and data engineering support to a strategic intelligence mission. Ensure efficient and organized use of intelligence information to inform senior leadership and drive operational priorities within the organization. Individuals interested in this role will provide Data Science subject matter expertise and be essential in the programs modernization through prioritization of data-based decision making.

Responsibilities
Develop data analytics and modeling of intelligence information from high capacity data lakes
Perform predictive analytics, statistical analysis, and trending based upon disparate data sources
Manage and normalize a variety of data sources containing unstructured data into a resource capable of informing operational decision making
Develop data management solution capable of ingesting historical data and normalizing newly generated intelligence information
Correlate disparate indicators and artifacts across intelligence information types to identify and prioritize intelligence resources
Guide and manage other Data Scientist and Data Engineers supporting similar projects and agency strategic objectives

We are looking for a highly skilled and versatile individual to join our team in the unique and exciting role that is part Data Scientist and part Loyalty Economist. In this hybrid role, you will combine your expertise on data analysis, statistical modeling, and economic understanding to drive actionable insights and strategic decisions for our loyalty program. As a key member of the Business Intelligence team, you will contribute to the optimization of our loyalty initiatives, enhance player engagement, and provide valuable recommendations based on data-driven insights.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain the virtual loyalty economies within our mobile games.
Utilize data-driven approaches to model customer behavior, including loyalty earning and spending patterns.
Analyze and interpret loyalty program performance metrics, identifying trends and opportunities for optimizations.
Develop predictive and prescriptive models using statistical and/or machine learning algorithms to solve loyalty business challenges, such as customer segmentation, demand forecasting, or recommendation systems.
Clean, preprocess, and explore large datasets to uncover patterns, trends, and insights relevant to business objectives.
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to assess the effectiveness of loyalty program enhancements and modifications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align on loyalty strategies with overall business goals.
Take pride in the quality of your work output. Your code, analyses, and documentation all reflect that of someone who is extremely detail oriented.
Create presentations for and present to peers, playAWARDS and PLAYSTUDIOS executives, and playAWARDS B2B strategic partners.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in business, data science, economics, statistics, analytics, or another related degree
5+ years prior experience in business intelligence/data science and working with BI tools
Advanced SQL and Excel skills
Proficient in programming languages such as Python and R for data analysis, modeling, and visualizations
Proven experience working with large datasets, cleaning, processing data, and performing exploratory data analysis.
Excellent communication skills to convey technical findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong data visualization skills and experience working with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Mode Analytics, Sisense)
Knowledge of data management, and working in both structured and unstructured data.
Strong understanding of virtual economies, economic theories, principles, and their application to consumer behavior and/or loyalty programs.
Prior experience in either social gaming, casino/hospitality, or related experience is a plus.
Benefits
100% Health Benefit Premium coverage for you and your dependents
401K match and Restricted Stock Units
Performance-based bonuses
Flexible vacation policy
Employee-driven entertainment, happy hours, and team-building events.
Snacks and drinks are available in the kitchen
Casual work environment
A great place to work. Come find out for yourself!
About PLAYSTUDIOS

PLAYSTUDIOS is the developer and operator of award-winning free-to-play casual games for mobile and social platforms. The company’s collection of original and published titles is powered by its groundbreaking playAWARDS loyalty marketing platform, which enables players to earn real-world rewards from a portfolio of global entertainment, retail, technology, travel, leisure, and gaming brands across 17 countries and four continents. Founded by a team of veteran gaming, hospitality, and technology entrepreneurs, PLAYSTUDIOS brings together beautifully designed mobile gaming content with an innovative loyalty platform in order to provide its players with an unequaled entertainment experience and its partners with actionable business insights. To learn more about PLAYSTUDIOS, visit playstudios.com

About COE
Have you ever dreamed of going to a job that you love? Well, you need to look no further - COE is an award-winning workplace with a balanced focus on client, employee, and company. We offer competitive benefits and a flexible environment focused on your success. We encourage all interested candidates to apply! It’s time to see if COE is the right place for the next step in your career - we are ready to invest in you!
As an EEO employer, COE celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment of equitability where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and COE employees. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.
About the Role
In anticipation of a contract award, COE is seeking customer-focused senior-level Data Scientist to provide expert consulting in collecting information, engaging multiple stakeholders, and assessing organizational effectiveness for our federal client. This position is responsible for the assimilation of information from multiple sources and developing documentation to support SOPs, organizational redesign, and/or process improvements for our client to optimize their delivery of services. This position is a hybrid role with primary focus on telework with occasional travel to local client site(s) within the Washington DC/Metro area.
Responsibilities
The candidate should apply with proven experience to execute the following:
Advising on AI/ML approaches by communicating changes in the industry, government policy, and applicable regulations.
Designing and building ML models using natural language processing and other methods.
Designing and building ML models to perform matching on structured and unstructured data sources as the basis for real world recommender engines.
Collaborating with UI/UX developers, ML engineers, and software engineers to design, build, deploy, and evaluate end-to-end solutions and ML feature prototypes.
Identifying performance metrics for ML models and monitoring performance throughout the development, testing, and deployment cycle.
Collaborating with subject matter experts across government to generate training and ground truth data for ML projects.
Developing and executing analysis plans to respond to requests for research/data analysis from government leadership, and customer agencies.
Clearly and concisely presenting findings of analytical products to non-technical audiences.
Leverage data analysis to construct strategic narratives.
Developing requirements for and testing machine learning operations workflows.
Present quantitative concepts in easy-to-understand formats and actively listen to identify business problems and their causes.

Experience and Skills:
Must have prior experience working with the Federal Government. Candidates without Federal experience will not be considered.
Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, engineering, social / physical / life science, business, or related field OR minimum five (5) years of experience in data analytics or a directly related field.
Five (5) or more years of analytical experience, in product / BI analytics, business operations.
Experience with reporting and visualization platforms.
History of ethical and value-based performance.
US citizenship is required.

Job Benefits:
We are proud to have been recognized by Forbes as one of America's Best Management Consulting Firms. COE has also received consecutive awards of the prestigious "When Work Works" award in recognition of our engaging corporate culture and strong employee benefits!

Position Summary
We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist to join our marketing activation team at Samsung Electronics America. The ideal candidate will design data solutions to optimize marketing strategies, drive customer engagement and enhance the overall customer experience. This role will involve analyzing vast datasets, developing predictive and other data science models, and collaborating cross-functionally to inform marketing decisions.
Role and Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities:
Extract, clean and analyze large volumes of data from various sources to support different marketing initiatives.
Develop and maintain prediction, optimization and other data science models to understand consumer needs and optimize marketing strategies
Analyze performance of data science models and results of different marketing tests using statistical validation methods
Develop methodologies for segmenting customer data to tailor different marketing initiatives.
Work closely with marketing, analytics, and business stakeholders to define and achieve data goals.
Work with engineering and product teams to productize data models and solutions
Clearly communicate complex analytical concepts and findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Write clean, efficient, and reusable code and contribute to existing documentation and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback
Mentor junior data scientists and contribute to team knowledge sharing.
Stay abreast of the latest trends in data science relevant to marketing, ensuring a deep understanding and application of the latest tools, techniques, and best practices
Core Qualifications:
MS in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in developing and maintaining Data Science applications/solutions for marketing, finance or other business-related fields.
Proficiency in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and predictive modeling.
Experience with ML algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, and recommendation systems.
Ability to apply data science/analytics framework to analyze consumer behavior, segmentation, and marketing performance.
Proven expertise in handling and analyzing large datasets and complex variables.

Skills and Technical Expertise:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and/or R and data manipulation tools (SQL, Pandas, etc.).
Advanced knowledge of Data Science frameworks, libraries and statistical methods.
Experience with big data technologies including Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.
Familiarity with data visualization tools and techniques.
Experience in cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP is desirable.
Personal Attributes:
Curious, ownership, and outcome mindset with the ability to pivot as per business requirements
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proactive and innovative mindset with a willingness to challenge the status quo.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Buffalo Manufacturing Works, operated by EWI, is a one-of-kind center for advanced manufacturing focused on developing, maturing and implementing new technologies that have an impact on the clients we work with and the communities in which they live. Located in Buffalo, New York, we are dedicated to building a nationally-recognized hub of manufacturing innovation and are looking for smart, passionate, entrepreneurial, inventive and driven people to help us achieve this goal.

We are searching for expertise, practical experience, and visionary thinking in manufacturing data science. Our customers are based across the country and include world-class leaders in the aerospace, automotive, consumer products, electronics, medical, energy & chemical, government, and heavy manufacturing industries.

EWI’s Data science group acts as turbo charger for EWI’s innovation engine. We specialize in working cross-disciplinary with EWI’s cutting-edge manufacturing technology teams including additive manufacturing (3D printing), advanced stamping, robotics, ultrasonics, and lasers. Data science focuses include using in-line sensing to predict part quality, semi-analytical modeling, probabilistic modeling, and data modeling.

Work on projects such as these:
Lithium Ion Battery Quality Control: https://www.spiedigitallibrary.org/conference-proceedings-of-spie/11591/115910I/Investigation-of-monitoring-methods-for-ultrasonic-metal-welding/10.1117/12.2583121.short

Smart Forming: https://www.mdpi.com/2076-3417/11/20/9530
Probabilistic Qualification: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11837-021-04770-3

We are currently looking to add a data scientist to our collaborative team of researchers.

Additive manufacturing (3D printing)
Advanced stamping
Robotics

Lasers
Identify potential solutions that could bring clear value to manufacturers

Organize data so that it is findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable
Develop, apply, iterate, and test analytics
Present results to stakeholders
Establish thought leadership through conference presentations, peer reviewed publications, patents, and marketing pieces

Python and version control

Experience testing and applying a range of ML/AI approaches

Exhibit and maintain positive, solutions-oriented attitude toward work and co-workers
Excellent organizational skills and ability to work well under stress, despite numerous interruptions
High degree of accuracy and attention to detail in assigned tasks on a consistent basis
Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with all levels of associates
Team-oriented attitude and focus with strong ability to collaborate with others

The candidate should have at least one of the following deep skills:
Demonstrated expertise in data modeling including schema development and metadata curation. Experience with semantic web preferred.
Demonstrated real-world applications of statistics including probability theory. Experience with Bayesian networks preferred.
Demonstrated expertise in sensor interfacing, data logging, sensor interpretation, and controls. Additional experience in human interface development preferred.

Position Overview:
About Rare
Rare inspires change so people and nature thrive. For over 45 years, across 60 countries, we have inspired and empowered millions of people and their communities to shift their behaviors and practices to protect our shared planet. We are a global leader in driving social change for people and nature and believe that the cumulative power of individual and community action is a vital pathway to safeguarding and restoring our shared waters, lands, and climate.
Fish Forever is Rare’s global initiative to restore near-shore fisheries in the tropics. Fish Forever is helping improve fishery productivity, profitability, and sustainability while also boosting livelihoods, protecting habitats, and enhancing coastal resilience to climate change. Fish Forever is currently entering the third phase of the program and is looking to significantly scale its impact around the world.

Position Overview
The Fish Forever Global Operations team provides technical support to Fish Forever implementation staff in areas related to program operations. This includes data management components, including tool development, data analysis, visualization innovation, and information sharing. We continue to invest in data collection across our global programs and have strong partnerships with leading academic institutions around the world to collaborate on analysis, modeling and developing innovative solutions.

The Sr. Associate, Data Science and Analysis will play a pivotal role in making data accessible to those who need it within the organization, supporting a data-driven culture that extends beyond internal operations. The position will also play a vital role in building the capacity of country teams around data management. Through skills in web development, data management, and advanced analytics, this role is integral in ensuring that data is accessible, understandable, and actionable for diverse stakeholders, both internally and externally.

Responsibilities
Data Science
Assist in the management of data-processing pipelines to clean, aggregate, and organize data from various sources
Manipulate and analyze large datasets using statistical techniques to identify trends, anomalies, and patterns
Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand data needs and deliver solutions to inform strategic and operational decisions
Develop, test, and enhance monitoring tools to maintain data quality and ensure data integrity across platforms
Stay updated on the latest industry trends and technologies to ensure that the company remains at the cutting edge in data analytics
Quality Control
Assist in ensuring data is accurate and collected on time and using the agreed-upon tools.
Assist in the development and maintenance of program-wide standards for data quality.
Assist in the process of resolving issues related to data quality.
Effectively communicate the importance of data quality to staff.
Web Development
Assist in the evolution/enhancement of Rare’s web-based visualizations and dashboards to meet the organization’s needs by providing meaningful data representation of data using platforms such as shinyapps.io, Dash, or D3.js.
Collaborate with UI/UX designers to simplify and improve user interface accessible for various audiences, making data visualizations and platform functionalities intuitive and accessible even for those with limited technical backgrounds, capacities, and resources.
Regularly gather feedback from users, analyzing usage patterns and potential barriers to inform continuous improvement efforts.
Ensure that web platforms are optimized for performance and security, particularly when accessed from low-resource environments or devices.
Data Management
Assist in the maintenance and organization of program datasets.
Develop, optimize, and execute medium-to-complex SQL queries to extract, filter, and summarize data for analysis and reporting.
Collaborate with data, science, and tech teams to improve the efficiency of data storage and retrieval processes.
Assist in the creation of documentation related to data management processes, schemas, and methodologies.
Contract Management
Assist in the evaluation and identification of opportunities to outsource projects to external contractors or firms to optimize resources and timelines.
Assist in the drafting, reviewing, and negotiating of technology-related contracts, ensuring that they clearly define the scope of work, deliverables, timelines, costs, and terms.
Build relationships with contractors and external development teams, setting clear expectations and maintaining open lines of communication.
Assist in the management of project timelines and budgets to ensure that outsourced work is delivered as planned.
Implement tracking and reporting mechanisms to regularly assess the performance and deliverables of contractors.
Qualifications
Degree in computer science, mathematics, information systems, or a related field; OR an equivalent combination of experience and training.
Demonstrated experience with web-based visualization tools and techniques
Skilled in languages such as Python, R, JavaScript, and SQL
Demonstrated organizational, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills, especially in a global context.
Attention to detail and the proven ability to juggle multiple tasks.
Hands-on experience with web servers and cloud services, such as AWS and Digital Ocean
A strong understanding and application knowledge of AI, machine learning, and deep learning techniques.
Eagerness to learn new tools, software, and systems as the role evolves.
Ability to work to tight deadlines under limited supervision.
Project Management experience and proficiency in using and managing projects with GitHub preferred.
Exposure to data quality control is preferred.
Experience working with consultants, or contractors preferred.

Rare is an equal-opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, gender, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic.

About BlueHalo Intelligence Systems
BlueHalo's Intel division provides specialized operational support, services and technology to plan, design, develop and execute critical missions in the national security community. BlueHalo generates actionable insights from analytics through a suite of operationalized AI/ML tools for data collection/ingestion and subsequent text, geospatial, time series and image/video analytics to support open-source intelligence. BlueHalo is a national source for classified Cyber/SIGINT missions and a leading provider of blockchain/crypto analytics and platform cyber resiliency, specializing in offensive and defensive cyber and SIGINT warfare technologies.
Leading the Transformation: The BlueHalo Effect It speaks to who we are as a company, a global protective ring that shields everything we most want to safeguard, an unbroken line that ensures our customers retain the advantage in any battlespace, from high above the Earth to deep in cyberspace. The Aerospace Corporation is the trusted partner to the nation’s space programs, solving the hardest problems and providing unmatched technical expertise. As the operator of a federally funded research and development center (FFRDC), we are broadly engaged across all aspects of space— delivering innovative solutions that span satellite, launch, ground, and cyber systems for defense, civil and commercial customers. When you join our team, you’ll be part of a special collection of problem solvers, thought leaders, and innovators. Join us and take your place in space.
At Aerospace, we are committed to providing an inclusive and diverse workplace for all employees to share in our common passion and aspiration – to carry out a mission much bigger than ourselves.
The Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Department (DSAID) seeks a creative and enthusiastic Data Scientist to join a diverse team of engineers, data scientists, and programmers with a passion for researching, prototyping, understanding, and building AI and data enabled tools across the space enterprise. We are a growing, innovative, and collaborative department that makes meaningful contributions to National Security Space (AF, NRO, etc.), and Civil and Commercial customers (NASA, MDA, DHS, etc.).
Data Scientists contribute to projects involving one or more of the following disciplines: Data Science, Applied or Theoretical Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Deep Reinforcement Learning, Physics Inspired ML, Classification Systems, Natural Language Processing, Artificial Intelligence, or Computer Vision. They are team-oriented, take initiative, are focused on developing cutting-edge technologies and frameworks, and are comfortable balancing a variety of projects spanning internally funded research and development to direct customer support for mission-critical space systems. They may mentor other staff members, begin to specialize in a discipline of interest, and begin to provide technical input and leadership on their projects.
This positions specifically is for the Data Driven Algorithms Research section, where we conduct and review research on how cutting-edge technologies in Data Science and AI can be applied to various customer applications.
Work Model
This position can be hybrid with some onsite work in El Segundo, CA or Chantilly, Va.
What You’ll Be Doing
DSAID’s customers range from National Security Space (AF, NRO, etc.) to civil (NASA, NOAA, etc.) and commercial (commercial space, autonomous vehicles, etc.)
DSAID applies data science and AI knowledge across the space enterprise, to Aerospace enterprise capabilities, and towards corporate workforce development and strategic focus areas
Data Scientists learn and develop their skills by working on teams spanning disciplines, experience levels, and organizational boundaries.
Primary functions include:
Evaluation of technologies for use in scalable and resilient mission-critical applications in a production environment
Coordinated development and execution of experiments
Coordinated development of proof-of-concept infrastructure configuration and software prototypes
Collaboration with small, innovative teams to deliver features and products
Written and verbal presentation of results to team members and stakeholders
Reinforcing an environment of learning and progress with team members and others
Focus on accountability and innovation in leadership competency development
Duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned as needed
Data scientists must maintain a commitment to ongoing learning in order to stay current with government missions and the ever-changing climate of data science and AI. This requires both ongoing education in relevant domains, such as physics, math, and/or computer science, as well as an understanding of the existing systems and future objectives of government missions.
This position can be filled as an Senior Member Technical Staff or Engineering Specialist
What You Need to be Successful
Minimum Requirements: Senior Member of Technical Staff
Bachelors or Master’s degree from an accredited program in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Electrical or Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or related field(s)
5 or more years of experience in Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer or AI/ML Researcher role in any domain
Software development skills including familiarity with machine learning and deep learning libraries in Python
Some experience with and understanding of software engineering concepts (DevOps, algorithms, data structures, etc.)
Experience with and understanding of machine learning and statistics
Working knowledge of Unix/Linux operating systems
Demonstrated ability to cooperate as a member of a team
This position requires ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance, which is issued by the US government. U.S citizenship is required to obtain a security clearance.
What You Need to be Successful
Minimum Requirements: Engineering Specialist
Bachelors or Master’s degree from an accredited program in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Electrical or Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or related field(s)
8 or more years of experience in Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer or AI/ML Researcher role in any domain
Software development skills including familiarity with machine learning and deep learning libraries in Python
Some experience with and understanding of software engineering concepts (DevOps, algorithms, data structures, etc.)
Experience with and understanding of machine learning and statistics
Working knowledge of Unix/Linux operating systems
Demonstrated ability to cooperate as a member of a team
This position requires ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance, which is issued by the US government. U.S citizenship is required to obtain a security clearance.
How You Can Stand Out
It would be impressive if you have one or more of these:
Ph.D. from an accredited program in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Electrical or Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or related field(s)
Experience creating effective data visualizations and user interfaces, communicating results
Experience with containerization platforms (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
Demonstrated ability to operate independently and proactively seek guidance as needed
Demonstrated ability to exercise judgement and critical thinking in a scientific discipline
Participation in extracurricular activities related to data science (e.g. Kaggle competitions)
Domain expertise relevant to one or more customer organization mission areas (USSF, NRO, etc.)
Active security clearance

Our leadership philosophy is simple: every employee, regardless of level and role, can demonstrate leadership. At Aerospace, our commitment is our people. To cultivate our talent and ensure that we have a strong pipeline of future leaders, we want individuals who:
